awd_abstract_narration: This project consists of a series of numerical experiments                 designed to increase understanding of the internal variability of               the climate system.  It is necessary to have accurate estimates                 of the internal variability in order to identify climate signals                produced by external forcing.  The experiment will employ state                 of the art but relatively low resolution climate simulation                     models.  The main component for the initial experiments is an                   atmospheric general circulation model (GCM) with a realistic but                non-interactive biosphere.  A coupled ocean-atmosphere-biosphere                model will used in the following stages of the investigation.                   The experiments will be integrations of the numerical models for                periods on the order of 1000 years.  The data produced by the                   integrations will be reduced and analyzed by a variety of                       statistical diagnostic techniques.  The result of the experiments               will advance knowledge of internal variability by using models                  that are in some ways better and that are run longer than in                    previous work.                                                                       This project is funded under the NSF Climate Modeling,                     Analysis and Prediction initiative of the Global Change Research                Program.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
